com.company

Class Facade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.Facade

  • public class Facade
extends java.lang.Object
    Facade class, based on design patterns for simplifying the User Experience.
    See Also:
    clientSocket, id, money, Stock

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Facade() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean autoCycle(java.net.Socket clientSocket, int cycles)
      Method: autoCycle, automates the buy and sell functionality of the facade.
      static boolean buy(java.net.Socket clientSocket, java.lang.String company, int Shares)
      Method: buy, this method will ensure the local stocks list is up to date, there is sufficient funds to buy the specified stocks and then complete the action and store the owned stocks locally.
      static boolean display()
      Method: display, this method will display the stock information that is stored locally.
      static java.lang.String displayMoney()
      Method: displayMoney, displays the amount of money the client has.
      static boolean displayOwned()
      Method: displayOwned, shows the user what stocks are owned by the client.
      static boolean exit(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Method: exit, this method cleanly drops the connection to the server.
      static java.lang.Boolean get(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Method: get, this method will initialise the list of stocks with the first values read by the client.
      static boolean initiate(java.lang.String ip)
      Method: initiate, takes an IP address as a string and sets up the clients connection to the server.
      static boolean register(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Method: register, this method sends the "REGI" command to the server to retrieve a unique identifier for this clients connection.
      static boolean sell(java.net.Socket clientSocket, java.lang.String company, int Shares)
      Method: sell, this method will check that the specified stocks and amount are actually owned by the client and then update the current local values of all stocks and proceed with the transaction.
      static boolean setMoney(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Method: setMoney, this method sets the amount of money locally to the amount the server has allocated.
      static boolean test(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Method: test, ensures a connection is established between the client and server by sending "HELO" and reading a response.
      static java.lang.Boolean update(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Method: update, will continually be called throughout the running of the Facade operations to ensure that the client is performing calculations on the most up to date stocks from the server.

        public Facade()

    • Method Detail

      • initiate

        public static boolean initiate(java.lang.String ip)
        Method: initiate, takes an IP address as a string and sets up the clients connection to the server.
        Parameters:
        ip - IP address of the Stocks Server to connect to.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether initiation was successful.

      • test

        public static boolean test(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Method: test, ensures a connection is established between the client and server by sending "HELO" and reading a response.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether test "HELO" command was successful.

      • exit

        public static boolean exit(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Method: exit, this method cleanly drops the connection to the server.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the connection was closed successfully.

      • setMoney

        public static boolean setMoney(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Method: setMoney, this method sets the amount of money locally to the amount the server has allocated.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the money was set correctly.

      • register

        public static boolean register(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Method: register, this method sends the "REGI" command to the server to retrieve a unique identifier for this clients connection. This identifier is used in other methods such as Buy and Sell as the server requires any transaction to be authorised.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the client has registered successfully.
        See Also:
        buy(Socket, String, int), sell(Socket, String, int), display(), setMoney(Socket), update(Socket)

      • buy

        public static boolean buy(java.net.Socket clientSocket,
                          java.lang.String company,
                          int Shares)
        Method: buy, this method will ensure the local stocks list is up to date, there is sufficient funds to buy the specified stocks and then complete the action and store the owned stocks locally.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        company - This represents the company name of the stocks.
        Shares - Number of shares involved in the transaction.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the purchase has completed successfully.
        See Also:
        stocks, update(Socket)

      • sell

        public static boolean sell(java.net.Socket clientSocket,
                           java.lang.String company,
                           int Shares)
        Method: sell, this method will check that the specified stocks and amount are actually owned by the client and then update the current local values of all stocks and proceed with the transaction.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        company - This represents the company name of the stocks.
        Shares - Number of shares involved in the transaction.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the transaction has completed successfully.
        See Also:
        stocks, update(Socket), money, setMoney(Socket)

      • get

        public static java.lang.Boolean get(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Method: get, this method will initialise the list of stocks with the first values read by the client. after this method, update(Socket), the Update method will handle the continued updated stock information.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the initial stock values have been retrieved.
        See Also:
        update(Socket), stocks

      • update

        public static java.lang.Boolean update(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Method: update, will continually be called throughout the running of the Facade operations to ensure that the client is performing calculations on the most up to date stocks from the server.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the stocks have been updated successfully.
        See Also:
        stocks, Stock

      • display

        public static boolean display()
        Method: display, this method will display the stock information that is stored locally.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the stocks have been updated successfully.

      • displayMoney

        public static java.lang.String displayMoney()
        Method: displayMoney, displays the amount of money the client has.
        Returns:
        value of the Money currently owned.
        See Also:
        money

      • displayOwned

        public static boolean displayOwned()
        Method: displayOwned, shows the user what stocks are owned by the client.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the owned stock has been displayed.

      • autoCycle

        public static boolean autoCycle(java.net.Socket clientSocket,
                                int cycles)
        Method: autoCycle, automates the buy and sell functionality of the facade. This method aims to be continually profitable and then displays the sum of profits to the user.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - This is the socket the client communicates with the server through.
        cycles - Number of iterations to automate the buy and sell functions.
        Returns:
        Boolean value to determine whether the cycles have completed successfully.
        See Also:
        buy(Socket, String, int), sell(Socket, String, int)
